intro: Pseudocytisus glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth broom, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often thornless stems and pairs of opposite leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, which bloom in early summer. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Pseudocytisus glabrescens is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various garden conditions.
